/-- `g` converges to `f.small_sets` if for all `s ∈ f`, eventually we have `g x ⊆ s`. -/
theorem tendsto_small_sets_iff {f : α → Set β} :
    Tendsto f la lb.small_sets ↔
      ∀ t ∈ lb,
        «expr∀ᶠ in , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr∀ᶠ in , »" la
          (f x ⊆ t) :=
  (hasBasis_smallSets lb).tendsto_right_iff
#align tendsto_small_sets_iff tendsto_small_sets_iff
tendsto_small_sets:
theorem has_antitone_basis.tendsto_small_sets {ι} [preorder ι] {s : ι → Set α} (hl : l.has_antitone_basis s) :
    Tendsto s atTop l.small_sets :=
  tendsto_smallSets_iff.2 fun t ht => hl.eventually_subset ht

/-- Generalized **squeeze theorem** (also known as **sandwich theorem**). If `s : α → set β` is a
family of sets that tends to `filter.small_sets lb` along `la` and `f : α → β` is a function such
that `f x ∈ s x` eventually along `la`, then `f` tends to `lb` along `la`.

If `s x` is the closed interval `[g x, h x]` for some functions `g`, `h` that tend to the same limit
`𝓝 y`, then we obtain the standard squeeze theorem, see
`tendsto_of_tendsto_of_tendsto_of_le_of_le'`. -/
theorem tendsto.of_small_sets {s : α → Set β} {f : α → β} (hs : Tendsto s la lb.small_sets)
    (hf :
      «expr∀ᶠ in , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr∀ᶠ in , »" la
        (f x ∈ s x)) :
    Tendsto f la lb := fun t ht => hf.mp <| (tendsto_smallSets_iff.mp hs t ht).mono fun x h₁ h₂ => h₁ h₂
#align tendsto.of_small_sets tendsto.of_small_sets
